definition: paper, plastic, etc. used for covering something in order to protect it
a narrow piece of material worn around the wrist, as a decoration, to take in sweat during exercise, or to show support for something
the activity of writing, in contrast to reading, speaking, etc.
the activity of writing books, articles, etc., especially as a job
books, articles, etc. in general
words that have been written or painted on something
the particular way in which somebody forms letters when they write
a group of pieces of writing, especially by a particular person or on a particular subject
in the form of a letter, document, etc. (that gives proof of something)
used when you are describing a situation in which there are signs that something is going to have problems or that it is going to be a failure
in a way that is not right or correct
in a way that is not fair or not morally right
an opinion or a way of thinking about ideas or situations
an innocent young woman, especially in a film or play
a word for a woman who is not married and is no longer young that is now considered offensive
a bowler who uses spin when throwing the ball
a person who spins wool into thread
a device that turns round and round, used on a fishing line to attract fish
humorous
a person who performs tricks that seem strange or impossible to believe
a person who always expects bad things to happen
a person who always expects good things to happen or things to be successful
that eats insects
able to capture and digest insects
the work or business of cutting down trees for their wood
a severe flood; a sudden very heavy fall of rain
a large number of things that happen or arrive at the same time
a large amount of water moving very quickly
a large amount of something that comes suddenly and violently
to have a particular opinion about somebody/something
a person who worries about unimportant things
a person who causes unnecessary fear and worry by what they say about something
a person who always agrees with people in authority in order to gain their approval
very impressive; very beautiful
excellent; very good
used to say ‘no’
to copy something, but change parts of it so that it is not as good as the original
evidence that shows that a business proposal, design idea, etc. will work, usually based on an experiment or a pilot project
the act of often changing your opinion or thoughts about something, especially in a way that annoys other people
lively and fashionable
using the best and most expensive seats or accommodation in a train, plane or ship
(in the UK) by the quickest form of mail
(in the US) by the class of mail that is used for letters
a way of walking or running
not covered with a hard, smooth surface; not paved
a person that somebody spends a lot of time with
a woman who is thought to be sexually attractive and trying to control men
a person, usually a woman, who behaves in a way that is intended to be sexually attractive but is not very serious
a substance obtained from the beans of a tropical plant, also called vanilla, used to add taste to sweet foods, for example ice cream
a pointed piece of ice that is formed when water freezes as it falls down from something such as a roof
the fact of being too proud of your own appearance, abilities or achievements
the fact of being unimportant, especially compared with other things that are important
behaviour or attitudes that show people’s vanity
a piece of bedroom furniture like a table with drawers (= parts like boxes in it with handles on the front for pulling them open) and a mirror on top
lack of serious thought or purpose
the act or process of turning into gas or of making something turn into gas
full of vapour; like vapour
a cover for a lamp that is used to make the light softer or to direct it
a false idea or belief, especially about somebody or about a situation
something that seems to exist but in fact does not, or seems to be something that it is not
the leaders of a movement in society, for example in politics, art, industry, etc.
the part of an army, etc. that is at the front when moving forward to attack the enemy
